content:
RibbonSplitButton Class

In this Article

Represents a composite control that has a primary button that responds to a Click event and a secondary button that displays a drop-down list of mutually exclusive values.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_HeaderButton", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase))]
[System.Windows.TemplatePart(Name="PART_ToggleButton", Type=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonToggleButton))]
public class RibbonSplitButton : System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton, System.Windows.Input.ICommandSource

Remarks

The following illustration shows examples of RibbonSplitButton controls in large, medium, and small variations, and with no images.


Ribbon split button controls

The following illustrations show RibbonSplitButton controls when the drop-down is opened.


Ribbon split button control with drop-down open

Properties summary

CheckedBackground

Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of the control when it is in the Checked state.
CheckedBorderBrush

Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when it is in the Checked state.
Command

Gets or sets the command that is associated with this control.
CommandParameter

Gets or sets a user-defined data value to pass to the command.
CommandTarget

Gets or sets the element on which to raise the specified command.
DropDownToolTipDescription

Gets or sets the descriptive text that is displayed in the ToolTip for the drop-down area of this control.
DropDownToolTipFooterDescription

Gets or sets the descriptive text that is displayed in the footer of the ToolTip for the drop-down area of this control.
DropDownToolTipFooterImageSource

Gets or sets the image that is displayed in the footer of the ToolTip for the drop-down area of this control.
DropDownToolTipFooterTitle

Gets or sets the title text that is displayed in the footer of the ToolTip for the drop-down area of this control.
DropDownToolTipImageSource

Gets or sets the image that is displayed in the ToolTip for the drop-down area of this control.
DropDownToolTipTitle

Gets or sets the title text that is displayed in the ToolTip for the drop-down area of this control.
HeaderKeyTip

Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the header area of this control.
HeaderQuickAccessToolBarId

Gets or sets a unique identifier that links a ribbon control to a corresponding control in the Quick Access Toolbar.
IsCheckable

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a user can check and uncheck the button.
IsChecked

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the button is checked.
LabelPosition

Gets or sets a value that indicates the relative position of the label for this control.

  • HeaderKeyTip

    Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the header area of this control.

    public string HeaderKeyTip { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The keyboard shortcut for the header area of this control. The registered default is null. For more information about what can influence the value, see Dependency Property Value Precedence.

    Remarks

    A KeyTip must be from 1 to 3 uppercase characters, and must not contain spaces, tabs, or newline characters.

    KeyTips are sometimes known as access keys or accelerators and are used as shortcut key combinations that activate controls. KeyTips appear on the Ribbon when you press the ALT key.

    Dependency Property Information

  • IsCheckable

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a user can check and uncheck the button.

    public bool IsCheckable { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the user can check and uncheck the button; otherwise, false. The registered default is false. For more information about what can influence the value, see Dependency Property Value Precedence.

    Remarks

    When this property is true, the button behaves as a RibbonToggleButton.

    Dependency Property Information

rawMetadata.title: RibbonSplitButton class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Represents a composite control that has a primary button that responds to a  event and a secondary button that displays a drop-down list of mutually exclusive values.
